Sentencas: Power-to-Gas (PtG) is a grid-scale energy storage technology by which electricity is converted into gas fuel as an energy carrier.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant

Sentencas: PtG utilizes surplus renewable electricity to generate hydrogen from Solid-Oxide-Cell, and the hydrogen is then combined with CO2 in the Sabatier process to produce the methane.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant

Sentencas: The transportation of methane is mature and energy-efficient within the existing natural gas pipeline or town gas network.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant

Sentencas: Additionally, it is ideal to make use of the reverse function of SOC, the Solid-Oxide-Fuel-Cell, to generate electricity when the grid is weak in power.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant

Sentencas: This study estimated the cost of building a hypothetical 100-MW PtG power plant with energy storage and power generation capabilities.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant

Sentencas: The emphasis is on the effects of SOC cost, fuel cost and capacity factor to the Levelized Cost of Energy of the PtG plant.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant

Sentencas: The net present value of the plant is analyzed to estimate the lowest affordable contract price to secure a positive present value.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant

Sentencas: Besides, the plant payback period and CO2 emission are estimated.
Titulo: The economic feasibility study of a 100-MW Power-to-Gas plant
